item.title: Unsolicited: A Personal Cartography of Harassment in Boston Common & the Public Garden
item.description: I created this map and layout as a personal project focusing on critical cartography.

item.title: Spatial Analysis and Information Design: Tracking Bike and Pedestrian Danger
item.description: I analyzed nearly a decade of bike and pedestrian crashes to provide insight into crash factors and consequences in Saint Paul, MN.

item.title: Climate Vulnerability and Resilience Mapping
item.description: Contributing to these ArcGIS Story Maps was a highlight of my internship with the Metropolitan Council.

item.title: Planning for Racial Equity in Brightfield Development: Lessons from Scituate, MA
item.description: I spent the fall semester of my Senior year researching a case study of solar-on-landfill or “brightfield” solar development.

item.title: Reference Mapping
item.description: I created this reference map of Spain for my intro GIS class the semester before I studied abroad in Granada, Spain.

item.title: Urban GIS: Mapping Access to Early Childhood Education
item.description: My Urban GIS class produced an analysis of city-wide early education access in partnership with the Saint Paul city council.

item.title: Mixed Media
item.description: I created these works of mixed media art as explorations of color, shape, and depth.

item.title: Transit Oriented Development Guide
item.description: During my internship with the Metropolitan Council, I had the opportunity to work on the Transit-Oriented Development “TOD” Guide, a resource for local planners, elected officials, planning commissioners, and others to learn about planning for and implementing TOD.

item.title: Community Perspectives on Stadium Development
item.description: For my Qualitative Research Methods class I interviewed local residents, business owners, and organization leaders to document their perspectives on the introduction of a Major League Soccer stadium in the neighborhood.

item.title: Uncommon History: Boston Common & the Public Garden
item.description: Making this map gave me the chance to explore Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator, and to learn more about the history of my hometown.

item.title: Interactive Dashboards
item.description: As part of my internship with the Great Plains Institute, I’ve had the opportunity to create multiple interactive online maps.

item.title: Getting Sentimental: An Analysis of Twin Cities Tweets and Headlines
item.description: I worked with classmates to produce this sentiment analysis of local news headlines and tweets.

item.title: Analyzing the Sustainability of a Coastal Spanish City
item.description: While studying abroad in Granada, Spain, I enrolled in a class at the University of Granada focused on the sustainable planning and management of urban spaces.

item.title: A First Foray into Animation with Photoshop
item.description: I used Adobe Photoshop to create an original GIF.

item.title: Analysis of Rooftop Solar Generation
item.description: I analyzed a year’s worth of minute-by-minute data to assess the seasonal reliability of rooftop solar, using EV charging as an end-use test case.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
